message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about predator-prey dynamics and the energy requirements of animals. As wolves need more energy to catch fast prey, their heart rates will increase. Option (A) is incorrect because as the wolves exert more physical effort, their pulse will actually increase. Option (B) is unrelated to the energy requirements of wolves. Option (D) is unrealistic because wolves are not capable of using vehicles to chase their prey.

This question requires basic knowledge about the physiological response of animals to increased energy demands. When wolves need more energy to catch fast prey, their heart rates will increase. This is because an increased heart rate allows more blood to circulate and deliver oxygen and nutrients to the muscles, enabling the wolf to have more energy and sustain the chase. Option (A) is incorrect because an increased heart rate would result in an increased pulse, not a decrease. Option (B) is unrelated and irrelevant to the question. Option (D) is absurd and not supported by any factual information.

This question requires basic knowledge about the relationship between energy requirements and heart rate in animals. As wolves need more energy to catch fast prey, their heart rates will increase to supply more oxygen and nutrients to their muscles. Option (A) is incorrect because a decrease in pulse would indicate a decrease in heart rate, which is not consistent with the information given. Option (B) is unrelated to the energy requirements of wolves. Option (D) is not a biologically plausible response as wolves do not have the ability to use vehicles.
